data.title: Operating Partners Forum
data.meta_description: The premier PE operations event of the industry attracting the largest community of operating partners in North America. Find out more.
data.text:
Mark is a senior operating executive and member of Gryphon’s Operations Resources Group where he helps portfolio companies implement best practices in operational finance, accounting, planning and analytics, tax, and information technology, with a focus on growth, scalability, efficiency, and governance.

Prior to joining Gryphon, Mark was President & COO of NV5 Global, where he led the geospatial technology platform of this publicly traded engineering services firm, expanding capabilities and market reach through the acquisition and integration of leading technologies. Prior to NV5, Mark’s private equity experience included COO/CFO roles of technology leader Quantum Spatial and pharmaceutical producer Alcami. Mark is the former CFO of GE Healthcare Medical Devices and former Global Controller for GE Energy Products. Mark started his career in public accounting with KPMG.

Headquartered in San Francisco, Gryphon Investors is a leading middle-market investment firm focused on competitively advantaged companies in the Business Services, Consumer, Healthcare, Industrial Growth, and Software sectors. Gryphon’s integrated Deal-Ops business model includes highly experienced investment professionals who work alongside full-time senior operating executives with general management, human capital, IT, treasury, finance and accounting expertise. Gryphon’s differentiated model has been a critical driver of the firm’s stable returns, significant alpha creation, and zero loss ratio since 2008. With approximately $9 billion of assets under management, Gryphon’s private equity funds target investments of $50 million to $500 million while the junior capital fund targets investments ranging from $5 million to $25 million. Recently, Gryphon was recognized by Inc. Magazine as a top 2023 Founder-Friendly Investor. Additional information on Gryphon can be found at: https://www.gryphon-inv.com/

Nadeem is a Partner in CrossCountry Consulting’s national Private Equity practice based in Dallas, Texas. A hands-on M&A leader with over 20 years of experience across the transaction lifecycle – from diligence to post-close transformation – he has particular expertise in infusing analytics and data-driven decision-making into an organization’s business processes to drive revenue growth and increase operational efficiency.

Prior to CrossCountry, Nadeem was a Managing Director in KPMG’s Deal Advisory and Strategy practice, providing technology strategy, digital transformation, and performance improvement support to private equity firms and their portfolio companies before joining West Monroe’s Technology Transaction Services as Senior Partner.

Preceding his consulting career, Nadeem spent many years working at product technology companies, including one which he co-founded, where he held roles from software engineer to CTO, giving him a unique perspective that he now brings to the technology M&A space.

Nadeem earned his bachelor’s degree from the University of Manitoba, Canada, and a master’s and Ph.D. in electrical engineering from Rice University.

CrossCountry Consulting is a leading provider of specialized finance, operations, and technology advisory services. As a trusted advisor to Fortune 500 companies, emerging growth market leaders, and private equity sponsors, the firm solves today’s most pressing challenges and creates present and future enterprise value through accounting and risk, technology-enabled transformation, and transaction solutions. Headquartered in Washington, D.C., CrossCountry has employees across the United States and in strategic international locations. With an unwavering commitment to providing a better experience, they are regularly recognized as a best place to work. Learn more at crosscountry-consulting.com.

Experience:

Mr. Ashmore is Senior Vice President – Reporting & Insights in Portfolio Dynamics Group, a team dedicated to supporting Grain’s due diligence processes and portfolio company integration and operations to create value through sustained operational improvement, where he oversees financial reporting, business intelligence and analytics.

Prior to joining Grain, Mr. Ashmore was an executive with Communications Management working exclusively with the Grain investment team and Grain portfolio companies on financial reporting, optimization, and analytics. Mr. Ashmore has over 20 years of experience in the global TMT sector, most recently serving in a variety of financial and general management roles at Cable & Wireless, now a subsidiary of Liberty Latin America. Previously, he held multiple senior level finance roles in Ireland, Australia, and in the Caribbean.

Education:

Mr. Ashmore holds a B.A. in Business Administration from John Moores University (Liverpool, UK) and is a Fellow of The Institute of Public Accountants (Australia).

About Grain Management:

Founded in 2007, Grain Management is a leading, global investment firm. We believe broadband and digital infrastructure are foundational to the tech-enabled transformation occurring across all industries and facets of society. Our global team of seasoned and diverse professionals share a collective passion for the power of connectivity to strengthen communities and unlock human potential for all.

We specialize in digital infrastructure and are a trusted solutions provider to the broadband and communications industry. Our unique combination of sector knowledge, experience as operators, and disciplined analytical approach guide our differentiated investment strategy across fiber networks, data centers, wireless spectrum, cell towers, as well as managed and infrastructure services.

Annie Asrari is an Operating Principal at Accel-KKR.

Prior to joining Accel-KKR, Annie was the Chief Product Officer at Castellan, where she led the positioning, grew Castellan’s product portfolio, and built a product management practice. During her tenure at Castellan, Annie directed Castellan’s product strategy from a single product to a platform approach, launched organic products, integrated M&A add-ons, and built and led migration plans. Castellan was acquired by Riskonnect, where Annie served as VP of Product Management and focused on company integration as well as leadership of additional product lines. Prior to Castellan and Riskonnect, Annie spent seven years at Everbridge building product strategy, launching and growing organic products, and integrating numerous acquisitions. Prior to Everbridge, Annie held Product Management positions at several technology companies.

Annie received an M.B.A. from Babson College, and a B.S. in Computer Engineering, from the University of Massachusetts, Dartmouth.

Accel-KKR’s culture is built on a strong work ethic and drive to succeed and is one that values integrity and collaboration. Our investment and operating professionals have extensive experience in the technology space. The team is disciplined in its investment approach and dedicated to helping our portfolio companies grow and succeed.

Brian Barnum is the Operating Partner at Shamrock Capital Advisors and works with Shamrock's portfolio companies to improve operations and increase value. He currently serves as a director of Skillable, Ad Results Media, and Maple Media and has worked closely with the management teams of Bayard Advertising, Adweek, Iyuno, Wpromote, Appetize, RB Media and Questex. Prior to joining Shamrock in 2017, Mr. Barnum held a number of senior executive roles for privately held media, communications and technology companies including COO of Brighter, Inc. (aquired by Cigna), COO/CFO of the Rubicon Project (now Magnite), the COO/CFO of Business.com and later the President of Dex Media's Digital businesses (now Thryv Holdings) after it acquired Business.com, the CFO of Rent.com through its acquisition by eBay (now RentPath), and the CFO of Transaction Network Services, which he guided through an IPO. Prior to his roles as an operating executive, Mr. Barnum worked in investment banking to media companies at Bankers Trust Company and to technology and communications companies at Alex. Brown & Sons.

Mr. Barnum has an MBA from the UCLA Anderson School of Management and has a BA in Economics from Stanford University.

Shamrock Capital Advisors, LLC is a Los Angeles-based investment firm with approximately $3.8 billion of assets under management. Shamrock Capital invests exclusively in media, entertainment, communications, and related sectors through a multi-fund strategy centered on private equity investments and entertainment intellectual property rights ownership. Shamrock Capital was originally founded in 1978 as the family investment company for the late Roy E. Disney and has since evolved into an institutionally backed firm with a leading group of investors, including endowments, foundations, and pension funds. Shamrock Capital partners with strong management teams and takes an active, collaborative approach to creating value in each investment. Shamrock Capital’s current private equity investments include Ad Results Media, Adweek, Bayard Advertising, Branded Cities, Canopy Spectrum, DeCurtis, Excel Sports Management, Iyuno-SDI Group, Learn on Demand Systems, Maple Media, Omega Wireless, Pixellot, SpotOn, and Wpromote. In addition, Shamrock Capital owns a diversified portfolio of premium content consisting of an economic interest in over 600 films, over 1,000 television episodes, and over 20,000 music compositions. For more information, visit Shamrockcap.com.

Ted is an internationally-recognized expert on leadership and organization development. He advises investors, CEOs, and boards globally to help them position the right leaders for key roles and to support those leaders and teams for maximal value creation. Ted assists top performing organizations to anticipate and plan for future core business competencies and to install them in dynamic governance processes such as executive succession.

An organizational psychologist, human resources executive, management consultant and master coach for more than 30 years, Ted authors a bi-monthly leadership column in Chief Executive magazine and is also on the executive education faculty of the Harvard Business School. Ted has helped leaders around the world achieve enduring change in their organizations, their teams, and themselves by expanding their psychological, behavioral, and organizational insights into leadership.

Career Highlights: Ted Bililies, PhD:

• Internationally recognized expert on leadership and organization development

• Founded AlixPartners’ transformative leadership practice in 2014, advising global CEOs, their boards, and private equity investors

• Serving nearly three decades as an organizational psychologist, human resources executive, management consultant and master coach

• Executive Education faculty of the Harvard Business School and has held teaching appointments at Harvard University in four of Harvard’s graduate schools: Medical, Business, Arts & Sciences, and Extension

• Frequent speaker at leadership and investment conferences

• Featured in Fortune, The Wall Street Journal, Bloomberg, and CNBC’s Power and Money

• Author of bi-monthly leadership column in Chief Executive magazine

• Serves as exclusive advisor to the CEO of the Year Award committee

• Board Member, Perkins School for the Blind

• Board Member, Boston Graduate School of Psychoanalysis

• John Harvard Scholar, graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University

For nearly forty years, AlixPartners has helped businesses around the world respond quickly and decisively to their most critical challenges – circumstances as diverse as urgent performance improvement, accelerated transformation, complex restructuring and risk mitigation.

These are the moments when everything is on the line – a sudden shift in the market, an unexpected performance decline, a time-sensitive deal, a fork-in-the-road decision. But it’s not what we do that makes a difference, it’s how we do it.

Tackling situations when time is of the essence is part of our DNA – so we adopt an action-oriented approach at all times. We work in small, highly qualified teams with specific industry and functional expertise, and we operate at pace, moving quickly from analysis to implementation. We stand shoulder to shoulder with our clients until the job is done, and only measure our success in terms of the results we deliver.

Our approach enables us to help our clients confront and overcome truly future-defining challenges. We partner with you to make the right decisions and take the right actions. And we are right by your side. When it really matters.

Mr. Chesebrough, Operating Partner, joined New Mountain in 2022. Mr. Chesebrough has spent his entire career as a Growth Officer and Commercial Excellence executive, and he has worked in many industries in the B2B arena including: technology, discrete manufacturing, distribution, media, healthcare, and financial service. Prior to joining New Mountain, Mr. Chesebrough was an Operating Executive with TPG Capital from 2012 to 2021 where he was a leader on the Sales Effectiveness team. During his tenure at TPG, Mr. Chesebrough led sales transformations and turnarounds at a number of portfolio companies – where he often took the role of Acting CRO or Head of Sales Operations. Prior to TPG, Mr. Chesebrough held positions as Managing Director of the Revenue Enhancement practice at Alvarez & Marsal and Chief Revenue Officer at Corbis Corporation. He holds a BA in economics from Amherst College and an MBA from Harvard Business School. He is a Certified Turnaround Professional (CTP) and a former member of Board of Directors of the Turnaround Management Association (TMA).

Jim is a co-founder of Blue Ridge Partners and serves as the firm’s Managing Partner. For 35 years he has assisted companies in North America, Europe and Asia accelerate profitable revenue growth. Jim has advised over 300 companies on revenue-related issues including growth strategy, pricing, sales and marketing management and effectiveness, customer segmentation and messaging. Prior to founding Blue Ridge Partners, Jim was a Partner at both McKinsey and Company and Accenture. He was also the President of the worldwide professional services group at Unisys and the Managing Partner of AT-T Solutions, the professional services arm of AT-T. Jim previously served as Managing Partner of Potomac Partners and CEO of Luminant.

Blue Ridge Partners is a management consulting firm exclusively focused on helping companies accelerate profitable revenue growth. We have worked with more than 1,000 companies to improve their strategic understanding of markets and customers, deepen and expand their customer relationships, and enhance marketing and sales performance.

Our clients include over 130 private equity firms and their portfolio companies –supporting them during deal evaluation, due diligence, and post-acquisition. We have a reputation for helping companies grow faster by rolling up our sleeves, working collaboratively, and delivering measurable impact quickly and more efficiently than large consultancies.

Russ Findlay is a sales and marketing executive currently serving as a Senior Executive Director and Operating Partner for H.I.G Capital. where he focuses on marketing due diligence, value creation planning and portfolio company operations. Russ is responsible for helping portfolio companies develop and implement comprehensive digital and marketing strategies.

Russ has over 30 years of experience in a broad range of industries including CPG, Food & Beverage, Sports & Entertainment and Financial Services. Prior to joining H.I.G., Russ was the Global Chief Marketing Officer of international specialist insurer Hiscox. Before Hiscox, he was the Head of Marketing for IHOP, the CMO of Major League Soccer, and a marketing executive for PepsiCo, where he launched the Sierra Mist and PepsiMax brands. Russ started his career at Unilever where he was the global expert in e-commerce prior to roles in brand management.

Russ earned his M.B.A. from Xavier University, a B.S. in Marketing from State University of New York, Oswego and a Financial Technology Certificate from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

H.I.G. Capital is a leading global alternative investment firm with $60 billion of capital under management.* Based in Miami, and with offices across the US and around the world, H.I.G. specializes in providing both debt and equity capital to middle market companies, utilizing a flexible and operationally focused/value-added approach across several funds including:

H.I.G.’s equity funds invest in management buyouts, recapitalizations and corporate carve-outs of both profitable as well as underperforming manufacturing and service businesses.

H.I.G.’s debt funds invest in senior, unitranche and junior debt financing to companies across the size spectrum, both on a primary (direct origination) basis, as well as in the secondary markets. H.I.G. also manages a publicly traded BDC, WhiteHorse Finance.

H.I.G.’s real estate funds invest in value-added properties, which can benefit from improved asset management practices.

H.I.G. Infrastructure focuses on making value-add and core plus investments in the infrastructure sector.

Since its founding in 1993, H.I.G. has invested in and managed more than 400 companies worldwide. The Firm’s current portfolio includes more than 100 companies with combined sales in excess of $53 billion.

Rory’s professional credentials have been built entirely within financial services technology delivery. His work has primarily focused on offsetting the inefficiencies created by the increasing gap between supply & demand in technology talent markets.

Recognizing that great people are central to the best business outcomes, Rory harnesses his Psychology background to create and implement tailored people-led solutions for Private Equity firms and their portfolio companies. This produces qualitative and quantitative efficiencies to technology delivery capability.

Recognizing the inherently unique demands of each firm Rory has been central in defining Saragossa products & services extending to; Project based Consultancy, Search & Selection and IT offshoring.

With an uncompromising dedication to delivering clear quantifiable improvements to business outcomes Rory has established a reputation as the trusted advisor to Technology leaders globally.

Saragossa is a Technology Solutions organisation with a proven track supporting Private Equity businesses, accelerating their portfolio companies. For nearly a decade we have provided support leading Private Equity organisations to maximise returns through rapid, specialised technology solutions. Providing strategic support alongside all of our core services: Project Delivery Consulting, Technology Outsourcing, Staffing, Executive Search, and 3rd party Talent Acquisition.

Having developed a reputation for unparalleled Private Equity domain expertise, we fully grasp the unique challenges presented managing an evolving technology business portfolio, responding rapidly to changing priorities and goals in a fiercely competitive landscape.

Our core values; Fearless, Uncompromising and Human underpin everything we do. We are brave, working outside of conventional methods to achieve agreed objectives, we do not compromise in our commitment to creating brilliant customer experiences, believing that great people are at the heart of every successful outcome.

Member of the Global Innovation and Technology leadership team. Mr. Ghai partners with Americas Private Equity investment teams, focusing on technology-related investment diligence and portfolio company value creation via digital transformation and technology modernization. He also supports the development and management of KKR's global portfolio technology platform. Previously Mr. Ghai was an associate partner at McKinsey & Company and a leader in McKinsey's Leap business building and technology practices. Before that, he was a senior vice president at TD Bank leading product and technology for a new business as well as payments capabilities for the bank. Prior to that, Mr. Ghai worked in client services at leading digital agencies SapientNitro and Isobar. Mr. Ghai earned his Bachelor’s and Master’s in Computer Science.

KKR is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. References to KKR’s investments may include the activities of its sponsored funds and insurance subsidiaries. For additional information about KKR & Co. Inc. (NYSE: KKR), please visit KKR’s website at www.kkr.com and on Twitter @KKR_Co.

Akshay Grover serves as the Global Private Equity practice leader at Zscaler. Akshay has 20+ years of results-driven and forward-thinking transformational leadership experience in Private Equity, M&A, Divestitures consulting, SaaS GTM strategies, partnerships & alliances and value creation with cloud technologies across Americas, EMEA, APAC and LATAM. Prior to joining Zscaler, Akshay co-led the Global Go to Market M&A Integration and WW M&A, Divestitures and PE practice at Salesforce. Akshay was responsible for developing new routes to market with alliance and PE partners and driving GTM M&A integration strategy, planning and execution for 15+ Salesforce acquisitions. Prior to joining Salesforce, Akshay held leadership roles at PwC, HCL Tech, Deloitte Consulting, and Tata Motors.

Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS) accelerates digital transformation so that customers can be more agile, efficient, resilient, and secure. The Zscaler Zero Trust Exchange protects thousands of customers from cyberattacks and data loss by securely connecting users, devices, and applications in any location. Distributed across more than 150 data centers globally, the SSE-based Zero Trust Exchange is the world’s largest in-line cloud security platform. Learn more at zscaler.com or follow us on Twitter @zscaler.

Doron Grosman is a serial Board Member, CEO/President and Private Equity Operating Partner with a proven track record achieving record revenue and EBITDA growth at leading private equity and public companies.

Currently Doron is the CEO/President of Smart Start, Inc. an Apollo Management portfolio company. Prior to that, Doron was the CEO/President of GCT Global Container Terminals a portfolio company of three equity investors, where he led a very successful sale to a strategic buyer.

Previously as an Operating Partner at Court Square Capital, Doron focused on leading portfolio company strategy and revenue growth acceleration, operational improvements and CEO hiring and mentoring. He was the interim CEO at DISA, and at Physiotherapy Associates.Doron was President of Hexcel Corporation, a public company, President of the Magazine Printing Solutions Business for Quebecor World and Chief Operating Officer for the global Trane Air Conditioning business. He began his career at GE in the Plastics business, where he led numerous businesses and spent 5 years at Bain & Co, after graduating from Harvard Business School.

Smart Start LLC, based in the Dallas suburb of Grapevine, is the acknowledged leader in alcohol monitoring nationally and worldwide with our advanced alcohol breathtesting technology. Smart Start’s Ignition Interlock is a convenient, discreet solution for impaired driving offenders. At the same time, SmartMobile™and BreathCheck™portable alcohol monitoring devices provide the greatest benefit at the lowest cost to users and monitoring authorities. Our SmartWeb™ online platform offers quick reporting and analysis for easy caseload management. Smart Start is Setting the Standard in Alcohol Monitoring Technology® with thousands of service locations across the U.S. and internationally, and a 24/7/365 multilingual Customer Care Center. Visit smartstartinc.com

Previously, Doron was the President of Hexcel Corp, a public company that is a global leader in advanced composites technology and the President of Quebecor Magazine Printing Solutions, where he was responsible for the successful turnaround of both these businesses.

Doron started his career at Bain & Company, the strategy and management consulting firm, and then spent eleven years in various senior executive capacities in General Electric both in the corporate office and at GE Plastics. Subsequent to his career at GE, Doron was the Chief Operating Officer (de facto) for American Standard’s global Trane Air-Conditioning business.

Doron holds a M.B.A. from Harvard Business School, and a Master of Science in Engineering from Witwatersrand University in South Africa.

GCT Global Container Terminals Inc. has been making waves in the marine container terminal industry for over a hundred years. GCT Canada has been operating on the West Coast since 1907 and is responsible for running both GCT Vanterm and GCT Deltaport. Beyond operating these facilities, GCT Canada has also played a major role in developing Canada’s Pacific Gateway. GCT’s two East Coast facilities, GCT Bayonne and GCT New York were established in 1972 and 1995, respectively. GCT’s high standards, customer focus, and leadership in safety, innovation, and automation have led to stable, long-term relationships with the majority of the world’s largest ocean carriers and shippers

Jawad Hussain leads MorganFranklin’s Private Equity Services practice and has extensive experience leading global M/A integrations and identifying synergies to achieve value realization for private equity firms, their partners, and portfolio companies. He employs proven methodologies, tools and reporting techniques that provide the right approach at each phase of the deal lifecycle and consistency across Private Equity portfolios. Jawad’s focus is on driving operational improvements to enable value creation.

Prior to joining MorganFranklin, Jawad led M/A integrations at CrossCountry Consulting where he collaborated with clients to execute end to end integration related activities to drive strategic growth. Jawad has a bachelor’s in finance from George Mason University.

MorganFranklin Consulting is a management consulting firm that works with leading businesses to address critical finance, technology, cybersecurity, supply chain and business objectives. The firm’s areas of expertise also include on-demand technical accounting, financial reporting, M&A lifecycle and integration, finance transformation, risk advisory, supply chain services, and the implementation of enterprise and cloud applications including NetSuite, SAP, Microsoft ERP, OneStream and more. MorganFranklin is headquartered in the Washington D.C. area with regional offices in New York, Philadelphia, Atlanta, Raleigh, Charlotte, Nashville, Dallas, Los Angeles and San Francisco. The firm supports clients across the globe.

Jamie Jacobs serves as the Chief Talent Officer of Oak Hill Capital. Working across the entire portfolio of Oak Hill funds focusing on all aspects of Human Capital with specialties in Talent Management, Talent Acquisition, Organization design and assessment, HRIS, compensation, and benefits advice. For almost eight years prior to partnering with Oak Hill, Jamie was the Director of Human Capital at American Securities where she worked with portfolio companies’ leadership teams on all aspects of Human Capital. Previously Jamie was with Morgan Stanley for nearly eleven years where she held a number of leadership positions within the firm including heading HR projects, program and data management for the wealth management division, restructuring and strategy for the firm’s recruiting function, Senior HR Business partner for the Private wealth management business, Head of Business Management for the International Private Wealth Management business and Head of Business Management and COO for the Global Talent Management organization. Earlier in her career Jamie worked in Management Consulting at PriceWaterhouseCoopers focusing on technology, business process, and strategy consulting. Jamie received a BS in Business and Economics from Lehigh University.

Oak Hill Capital is a private equity firm managing funds with over $19 billion of initial capital commitments and co-investments since inception. Over the past 36 years, Oak Hill Capital and its predecessors have invested in approximately 100 private equity transactions across broad segments of the U.S. and global economies. Oak Hill Capital applies an industry-focused, theme-based approach to investing in the following sectors: Business Services, Industrials, Media & Communications, and Consumer. Oak Hill works actively in partnership with management to implement strategic and operational initiatives to create franchise value. For more information, please visit: www.oakhill.com.

Danielle has been an Impact Advisor for GroundForce Capital since 2023. In this role, she works with the fund’s portfolio companies to implement and achieve best practices across impact and ESG. Danielle supports GroundForce Capital’s Investment Team and its Investment Committee to integrate impact and provide educational support for the firm. In addition, Danielle assists GroundForce Capital’s portfolio companies with remediating any ESG issues and helping them expand on current ESG policies and impact metrics.

Danielle recently founded her consulting practice, Impact FWD [fwd.eco], where she supports investors as an impact operating partner, and brands as a fractional head of sustainability. In this role, she helps define and operationalize sustainability strategies across investments, portfolio companies, and brands. Current clients include Nespresso, Cabinet Health and Lulu and Georgia as well as advisory relationships with EQT Partners and rePurpose Global. Danielle has expertise in impact investment diligence as well as operating expertise across consumer products, packaging, waste/materials, circularity and supply chain.

GroundForce Capital is an investment management firm that backs high-potential companies seeking to improve the health and longevity of people and the planet. The firm provides capital, strategic guidance and operating expertise to visionary companies including Bobbie, Liquid Death, OWYN, Miyoko's Creamery, KinderFarms, Thistle, and Vive Organic. GroundForce Capital's leadership team is comprised of innovators behind leading food and beverage brands, such as ZICO Beverages, an early pioneer in the coconut water category acquired by The Coca-Cola Company in 2013, and Health Warrior, a superfood company purchased by PepsiCo in 2018.

GroundForce Capital has offices in the San Francisco Bay Area and Los Angeles. For more information about the Firm, visit GroundForceCapital.com[cts.businesswire.com].

Ryan Jones is the Private Equity Global and US Consulting leader at Deloitte Consulting, and US India Board member. He and his team work with the world's leading private capital firms to maximize the value of their investments and make a positive impact in the world. Ryan’s work encompasses strategy and diligence, outcome focused ‘hands on’ business, as well as digital and IT transformation of portfolio companies. He works closely with buyout funds and operating teams to create value in the assets they own.

Prior to leading Private Equity, Ryan led Deloitte Consulting’s Technology Industry, where he and the team worked with the world’s most influential (and up and coming) Technology companies across the software, platforms, semiconductor, hardware, and consumer technology sub-sectors. Before Technology Industry, Ryan led Deloitte’s Technology, Media and Telecommunications investment fund, Deloitte Digital Central Region, and several of Deloitte's largest client relationships.

Ryan ‘grew up’ in Consulting digitizing his clients’ businesses, turning the old and complicated into the modern and simple. He provided both ‘born in the cloud’, and 30+ year old Technology companies a leg up in their growth and transformation: from strategy and advice, to changing business and operating models to be more Digital, often underpinned by large scale IT enabled business/digital transformations and commercial technology product modernization programs.

Ryan is a pioneer, with a unique capability to get things done, experienced leading high growth businesses and $1b+ P&Ls.

A future where more people have access to opportunities for creating wealth—it’s the promise of human-centered capitalism. Deloitte’s professionals bring a broad and powerful perspective that is experience-driven, strategic, and constantly evolving. Whether you’re in private equity, hedge funds, or mutual funds, Deloitte’s Investment Management practice can help you turn challenges into opportunities in an everchanging marketplace.

Senior Operating Partner. The Riverside Company

Marc Jourlait is seasoned business executive, Private Equity Senior Operating Partner, Chairman of the Board, Board Member, and battle-tested consumer and tech turnaround global CEO.

Jourlait is the Senior Operating Partner at Riverside Private Equity Value Fund. He is Chairman of the Riverside portfolio companies SCRAM Systems, PFB and siffron. Jourlait was recently Chairman of the Board of Avenga, an Oaktree Capital portfolio company, that just sold to KKCG. Jourlait is also Operating Partner for Cathay Capital as well as Executive Chairman of the Board for IMT, one of Cathay Capital’s portfolio companies. He also serves as Chairman of the Board of Electrosonic headquartered in London UK.

Before Riverside, Marc was CEO of Kodak Alaris where he stabilized and turned around the business portfolio preparing it for a divestiture. Prior to Kodak Alaris, Marc was Deputy CEO at Navico, a global leader in Marine Electronics, an Altor Private Equity owned portfolio company bought by Goldman Sachs in 2016. Before Navico, Jourlait was Vice President and General Manager of Bose Europe, where he ran the entire €1B European business for Bose.

Previously Jourlait held senior general management, product, and marketing positions over the course of his 35+ year career in some of the world’s leading companies including Apple, HP, Seagate, and Technicolor. With triple citizenship (France, USA, Canada), he resides in Manhattan and has lived and worked in a variety of countries, including France, the United States both in Silicon Valley and New York City, Japan, and Canada. Jourlait holds an MBA from ESCP Paris.

Raj Kushwaha joined Warburg Pincus in 2012 and serves as Co-Head of the Value Creation function. In addition to providing oversight for the Value Creation function, as the firm’s Chief Digital Officer, Raj is also responsible for product and technology diligence with prospective investments, as well as ongoing work with the firm's existing portfolio companies.

His work with portfolio companies is focused on identifying opportunities to leverage digital strategies and emerging technologies to create new growth platforms and disruptive business model opportunities. Mr. Kushwaha is a Director of Cyren, Encora (f/k/a Indecomm), and Arise. He also serves on the board of Nutrien and the Information Technology Committee of the Boards of Trustees of Mount Sinai. Raj brings over 30 years of experience in leading large-scale digital transformations, building commercial grade SaaS software platforms, and managing technology operations in Fortune 500 companies and Entrepreneurial late stage ventures. Prior to joining the firm, Mr. Kushwaha held senior management positions at Zimmer Holdings Inc., Dell Computer Corporation, PepsiCo, First Data Corporation (FDC), Cummins Engine Company and Safway, Inc. He has been recognized as one of the top 100 IT innovators in the automotive/manufacturing industry, is the recipient of a CIO 100 innovation award, is a noted industry author Financial services & Payments, and has numerous patents in the field of disruptive services technologies.

Mr. Kushwaha holds an M.S. in Management of Technology from MIT, an M.B.A. from the University of Wisconsin at Madison and ISU; a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from India and completed the Advanced Management Program (AMP) from Harvard University.

Warburg Pincus LLC is a leading global private equity firm focused on growth investing. The firm has more than $60 billion in private equity assets under management. The firm’s active portfolio of more than 200 companies is highly diversified by stage, sector, and geography. Warburg Pincus is an experienced partner to management teams seeking to build durable companies with sustainable value. Founded in 1966, Warburg Pincus has raised 19 private equity funds, which have invested more than $90 billion in over 930 companies in more than 40 countries. The firm is headquartered in New York with offices in Amsterdam, Beijing, Berlin, Hong Kong, Houston, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, Mauritius, San Francisco, São Paulo, Shanghai, and Singapore. For more information please visit www.warburgpincus.com.

Neil Kimber is a Principal and Consulting CTO at Accel¬-KKR Consulting Group. Within Accel-KKR, his responsibilities include working with deal teams during technical due diligence, aiding portfolio companies with specific technology initiatives and managing portfolio-wide technology programs.

Prior to joining the firm, Neil held leadership technology positions in a number of software and tech-enabled companies including PowerPlan, Fiserv and Kaplan. At PowerPlan, Neil led the technology organization and helped to grow the company leading to an enterprise sale from Thoma Bravo to Roper Technologies for $1.1 billion. Neil was CTO at Kaplan Learning Technologies, managing technology groups in North America, Europe and Africa. He was a part of the management team that led the business to an acquisition by Assima. At Fiserv, Neil was responsible for Engineering in the Risk and Compliance Division, providing solutions to banks with AUM $20 billion.

Earlier in his career Neil was a consultant at the Monitor Company (Monitor Deloitte).

Neil has an MBA in Management of Technology from the Georgia Institute of Technology, an M.S. in Computer Science from the Georgia Institute of Technology and B.S. in Computer Science from De Montfort University (UK)

Accel-KKR is a technology-focused investment firm with over $9 billion in capital commitments. The firm focuses on software and IT-enabled businesses, well-positioned for topline and bottom-line growth. At the core of Accel-KKR’s investment strategy is a commitment to developing strong partnerships with the management teams of its portfolio companies and a focus on building value alongside management by leveraging the significant resources available through the Accel-KKR network. Accel-KKR focuses on middle-market companies and provides a broad range of capital solutions including buyout capital, minority-growth investments, and credit alternatives. Accel-KKR also invests across a wide range of transaction types including private company recapitalizations, divisional carve-outs and going-private transactions. Accel-KKR is headquartered in Menlo Park with additional offices in Atlanta and London.

Jonathan Konkoly joined HCI Equity Partners in 2022 as Vice President of Portfolio Operations, with a focus on identifying and accelerating profitable revenue growth at our portfolio companies.

Jonathan brings to the position deep experience in go-to-market strategy, pricing, and commercial team effectiveness having consulted at Blue Ridge Partners, INSIGHT2PROFIT, and IRI. Earlier in his career, Jonathan held several management positions at McMaster-Carr Supply.

Jonathan received his MBA from Northwestern University’s Kellogg School of Management, and his BBA from Loyola University Chicago’s Quinlan School of Business.

HCI Equity Partners is a lower middle market private equity firm with approximately $1B in AUM, focused on partnering with family and founder owned distribution, manufacturing and service companies. HCI makes majority investments in businesses within North America in large, fragmented markets. HCI is headquartered in Washington, DC. For more information, please visit our website, www.hciequity.com.

Ajay Kutty (New York) is a member of the KKR Capstone team. Mr. Kutty partners with Americas Private Equity investment teams, focusing on technology-related investment diligence and portfolio company value creation via digital transformation and technology modernization. He also supports the development and management of KKR's global portfolio technology platform. Previously Mr. Kutty was Chief Product and Technology Officer at Symphony Talent, a leader in AI based Recruitment Marketing platform. Before that, he was Head of Enterprise Applications in CIO office at PTC, a global leader in CAD, PLM, IoT and AR. Prior to that, Mr. Kutty worked as a technology leader at Publicis Sapient, a global leader in digital transformations. Mr. Kutty earned his MBA from Columbia University and is a Bachelor of Engineering.

KKR is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management as well as capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of Global Atlantic Financial Group. References to KKR’s investments may include the activities of its sponsored funds and insurance subsidiaries. For additional information about KKR & Co. Inc. (NYSE: KKR), please visit KKR’s website at www.kkr.com and on Twitter @KKR_Co.

Misha Logvinov is a Director (Senior Operating Partner) on the Mubadala Performance Partner team, based in New York City. Mubadala is a sovereign investor with $284 Billion AUM. Misha’s responsibilities include advising the Mubadala’s investment teams and portfolio companies on digital transformation. Prior to joining Mubadala, he was Managing Director and Head of Technology Strategy at EQT Group where he helped build and lead its digital operating practice. Previously, he was Group Vice President of Cloud Customer Success at Oracle, where he helped lead the company's transition to cloud and directly oversaw product adoption, customer retention, and growth of Oracle's Cloud Infrastructure business in North America. Prior to Oracle, Misha served in various senior executive roles at Lithium Technologies (a cloud software company acquired by Vista Equity Partners and rebranded as Khoros), including Chief Information Officer, Chief Customer Officer, and SVP of Business Development. During his tenure, Lithium grew its revenue 6x and scaled its digital platform to support over 100 million users across hundreds of leading brands. Misha also has over 20 years of experience in technology leadership roles developing, scaling and advising venture-funded startups in Silicon Valley. Misha has a Bachelor's degree from Plekhanov Russian University of Economics.

Lee joined AEA Investors in 2019 and serves as an Operating Partner. In addition to providing oversight for the digital value creation function, Lee is also responsible for digital diligence with prospective investments as well as ongoing work with the firm’s existing portfolio companies. He is primarily focused on working with portfolio companies to assess, develop and identify opportunities to build value creation via digital initiatives.

Prior to AEA, Lee most recently served as Vice President of North America at Alibaba Group, leading the company’s North American initiatives. Prior to Alibaba, Lee was the first Global Head of Travel at Facebook, where he was responsible for developing the company’s monetization and growth strategy. Previously, Lee held various executive positions at Expedia, including overseeing APAC and North America where he led many supply optimization initiatives. Earlier in his career, Lee was part of the start-up office for eBay UK, where he helped drive eBay’s market penetration with several initiatives across supply, product, digital payments and platform trust and safety. Lee started his career with Warner Music in London.

Lee studied at Warwick Business School where he earned an MBA. He also earned an MA from Sheffield Hallam University in Media Production.

AEA Investors LP was founded in 1968 by the Rockefeller, Mellon and Harriman family interests and S.G. Warburg & Co. as a private investment vehicle for a select group of industrial family offices with substantial assets. AEA has an extraordinary global network built over many years which includes leading industrial families, business executives and leaders; many of whom invest with AEA as active individual investors and/or join its portfolio company boards or act in other advisory roles. Today, AEA’s approximately 100 investment professionals operate globally with offices in New York, Stamford, San Francisco, London, Munich and Shanghai. The firm manages funds that have nearly $15 billion of invested and committed capital including the leveraged buyouts of middle market companies and small business companies, growth capital and mezzanine and senior debt investments.

Pat Petitti is the co-founder and CEO of Catalant, which he started in 2013 as a class project at Harvard Business School and has since grown into the premier provider of agile consulting services to the Fortune 500. Petitti is also co-author of a book titled, Reimagining Work: Strategies to Disrupt Talent, Lead Change, and Win with a Flexible Workforce, which lays out a vision and path for a new relationship between global companies and talent. In 2016, he received an EY Entrepreneur of the Year Award for the New England region. Prior to co-founding Catalant, Petitti was a consultant at negotiation and conflict management consulting firm Vantage Partners, and before that at Booz Allen Hamilton. Petitti received his Bachelor of Science degree from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and MBA from the Harvard Business School.

Catalant Technologies is the creator of Consulting 2.0 and the leader in on-demand access to the world’s best independent consultants and teams. Trusted by hundreds of leading private equity firms and their portfolio companies for flexible, fit-to-purpose consulting, Catalant's platform gives firms and their portfolio companies access to a network of thousands of experienced business professionals, matching them to pre-vetted professionals who have solved their specific problems before.

Experience:

Mr. Rodriguez is a Managing Director on the Investment Team, responsible for deal origination and investment underwriting.

Prior to Grain, Mr. Rodriguez served as President and CEO of Spirit MTA REIT, a net lease real estate investment trust (REIT) with approximately $2.5 billion in AUM. Previously, he held positions across Morgan Stanley’s Global Capital Markets division, including developed and emerging markets roles.

Education:

Mr. Rodriguez holds a B.S. in Engineering and Economics from the United States Naval Academy.

About Grain Management:

Founded in 2007, Grain Management is a leading, global investment firm. We believe broadband and digital infrastructure are foundational to the tech-enabled transformation occurring across all industries and facets of society. Our global team of seasoned and diverse professionals share a collective passion for the power of connectivity to strengthen communities and unlock human potential for all.

We specialize in digital infrastructure and are a trusted solutions provider to the broadband and communications industry. Our unique combination of sector knowledge, experience as operators, and disciplined analytical approach guide our differentiated investment strategy across fiber networks, data centers, wireless spectrum, cell towers, as well as managed and infrastructure services.

Zorian is an Operating Partner at Charlesbank Capital, with a focus on tech GTM and Revenue Growth. He has a track record as a CRO in mid-market SaaS companies, scaling revenue from $20M to over $100M. His career started in Investment Banking at Merrill Lynch within the Financial Institutions Group (FIG), participating in $100+ billion in M&A and financing transactions, and also has worked on buy-side software deal teams investing in technology companies. Zorian has been a speaker at PE conferences, including PEI and ACG, on Capital-Efficient Revenue Growth and has been featured in the WSJ, as well as Salesforce and Hubspot discussing CEO & CRO strategies for growing companies faster and capital-efficiently. He earned a Finance degree with minors in Applied Mathematics and also in Computer Science from Lehigh University and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

Tim leads client strategy at Upwork where he helps leaders transform their businesses through the adoption of on demand talent solutions. He began his career as an early stage member of Mark Cuban's broadcast.com and, once acquired, he became the chief solutions officer at Yahoo!. He is also the author of five books, including the New York Times bestseller, Love is the Killer App: How to Win Business and Influence Friends.

Upwork is the world’s work marketplace connecting millions of businesses with independent talent around the globe. Help your portfolio companies find the on-demand talent they need because without effective execution, strategy only gets you so far.

Learn more about our partnership opportunities at upwork.com/enterprise/private-equity

Mr Satchell joined CD＆R in 2020. Prior to CD＆R, he spent twenty-five years in software and technology industries spanning five different CXO roles. Most recently, Mr Satchell served as CTO of Zume Inc., building AI, logistics and robotic systems to improve sustainability in the food supply chain. Prior to Zume, he served as chief product officer and head of consumer engineering at Comcast, responsible for product, design, and technology for consumer video, high speed data/Wi-Fi, IoT, and home security. Previously, Mr Satchell was CTO of Nike, helping to build their digital and direct-to-consumer businesses, and CTO and EVP of R＆D for IGT, the global leader in casino systems and entertainment. He started his executive career at Microsoft where he helped to build and ship Xbox 360 and was CTO of the interactive entertainment business. Mr. Satchell has a B.Sc. (Hons), computing, D.I.S., from Loughborough University.

Founded in 1978, Clayton, Dubilier ＆ Rice (CD＆R) is a private investment firm with a strategy predicated on building stronger, more profitable businesses. Since inception, CD＆R has managed the investment of more than $45 billion USD in 120 businesses representing a broad range of industries with an aggregate transaction value of more than $188 billion. The firm has offices in New York and London.

Rachel Spasser is a Managing Director leading the Operating Team at Accel-KKR. She also provides strategic guidance as well as commercial leadership across Accel-KKR’s portfolio. Prior to joining Accel-KKR, Rachel was the Senior Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer for Ariba, Inc.(acquired by SAP). At Ariba she led the design and execution of the company’s marketing strategy and programs.

Rachel has spent over 30 years focused on growth oriented B2B technology companies in general management, marketing leadership and business development roles. She speaks frequently on topics such as growing software businesses, marketing strategy, and customer engagement.

Prior to joining Ariba, she worked in executive roles with a number of cloud software and Internet-related companies including IBM and KnowledgeStorm Inc. (acquired by TechTarget)

Rachel’s current board seats include: Abrigo, Cendyn, Duett AS, ESG, Kantata, Loftware, Smart Communications and SugarCRM.

Ms. Spasser holds an MBA with honors from the Goizueta Business School at Emory University and a Bachelor of Arts degree from the University of Pennsylvania.

Accel-KKR

Accel-KKR is a technology-focused investment firm with over $9 billion in capital commitments. The firm focuses on software and IT-enabled businesses, well-positioned for top-line and bottom-line growth. At the core of Accel-KKR’s investment strategy is a commitment to developing strong partnerships with the management teams of its portfolio companies and a focus on building value alongside management by leveraging the significant resources available through the Accel-KKR network. Accel-KKR focuses on middle-market companies and provides a broad range of capital solutions including buyout capital, minority-growth investments, and credit alternatives. Accel-KKR also invests across a wide range of transaction types including private company recapitalizations, divisional carve-outs and going-private transactions. Accel-KKR is headquartered in Menlo Park with additional offices in Atlanta and London. Visit accel-kkr.com to learn more.

Juliane Stephan is a Director at Incline Equity Partners. Juliane’s career has been focused on identifying opportunities and crafting strategies for the adoption of technology innovation across industrial, consumer goods, and business services companies. As part of the Catalyst Group, she is focused on accelerating the growth of Incline’s portfolio companies through improvements in technology, operations, go to market and talent. Before joining Incline, Juliane was an Associate Partner at Bain & Company, where she led industrial technology strategy and performance improvement engagements. Prior to that, Juliane was a Director at PwC Strategy& where she focused on building and scaling the Digital Operations team in the US. Juliane serves as an Advisor to ZByte, the world’s first decentralized platform.

Incline Equity Partners, headquartered in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, is a private equity firm investing in manufacturing, distribution, and business services companies. Incline is generally seeking growing companies with enterprise values of $25 – $750 million. Incline's typical investment types are ownership transitions for privately held businesses, buyouts and corporate divestitures within the U.S. and Canada.

Shivani joined Charlesbank as an advisory director in 2018 to partner with portfolio company CEOs. Her mission is simple -- to accelerate growth and drive digital transformation. Shivani focuses on four key areas: eCommerce, digital marketing, analytics, and technology. She also leads the cybersecurity initiatives across the firm.

Shivani joined the firm from a Charlesbank portfolio company, FullBeauty Brands, where she served as executive vice president and chief digital officer. Previously, she was an operating adviser for Apax Partners leading the digital practice. Prior to Apax, she was multichannel director of New Look, driving a turnaround for the fashion business. She has held senior management roles and directorships at a host of major brands in the US and Europe, including Microsoft, Starbucks, Amazon, Expedia and Voyages-SNCF.

Shivani holds a BA from the University of Pennsylvania and an MBA from London Business School. She lives in New York City. In her free time, she enjoys rock climbing, sailing and diving. She is also a mentor for the Penn Wharton Entrepreneurship program and a guest lecturer at London Business School in the marketing and analytics departments.

Founded in 1998, Charlesbank Capital Partners is a private investment firm with more than $15 billion of cumulative capital raised since inception. The team has a long history of working together, a deep specialization in the middle market and experience investing over multiple business cycles. Known for its consistent, disciplined approach, Charlesbank invests primarily in North America through its flagship private equity, opportunistic credit and technology opportunities strategies, which leverage Charlesbank’s brand and collective insights, resources and networks. Charlesbank is guided by its mission to deliver superior risk-adjusted returns through a best-in-class team and culture. The firm has more than 130 staff members and offices in Boston and New York.

H. Kush Tulsidas is an Operating Partner focused on sales and marketing strategy and execution at One Rock’s portfolio companies. He is responsible for assessing the growth potential of companies in the investment stage and improving profitable revenue growth post acquisition. Mr. Tulsidas brings over 20 years of experience building and improving businesses and has worked in both large corporate settings as well as in private equity. Prior to joining One Rock, Mr. Tulsidas ran a consulting firm focused on growing private equity-backed companies in the middle market. Prior to that, he worked with The Riverside Company as an Operating Growth Executive. During his career, he has assisted companies across multiple industries improve sales organizations and processes, implement and drive appropriate key performance indicators (“KPI’s”) and grow revenue.

Previously, Mr. Tulsidas worked for the Nielsen Company, where he spent 9 years in senior leadership roles within the Sales, Consulting and Process Improvement departments. His most recent role at Nielsen was Senior Vice President, Client Consulting where he led the team responsible for servicing and retaining existing clients, growing share of wallet and driving new business in the media industry. Before joining Nielsen, Mr. Tulsidas worked at Cintas Corporation within their International Business and Six Sigma groups. He also founded and exited Soondar Secrets, an Organic Beauty company. Mr. Tulsidas started his career at KPMG in the audit function.

Mr. Tulsidas holds a B.Com. in international business and information systems from Curtin University and University of Illinois, Urbana Champaign. Mr. Tulsidas is also a Six Sigma Master Blackbelt and holds various certifications in Six Sigma, management, sales & negotiation and other trainings.

Founded in 2010, One Rock Capital Partners has ~$5.0 billion of cumulative capital commitments under management. One Rock makes controlling investments in companies with potential for growth and operational improvement using a rigorous approach that utilizes highly experienced Operating Partners to identify, acquire and enhance businesses in select industries. The involvement of these Operating Partners affords One Rock the ability to conduct due diligence and consummate acquisitions and investments in all types of situations, regardless of complexity. One Rock works collaboratively with company management and its Operating Partners to develop a comprehensive business plan focused on growing the enterprise and its profitability to enhance long-term value. One Rock has offices in New York and Los Angeles. For additional information about One Rock Capital Partners, please visit One Rock’s website at www.onerockcapital.com

Alexis Underwood joined Wynnchurch in 2024 as Managing Director of Commercial Excellence, Go-to-Market and Pricing. She partners with portfolio company leadership teams to improve their Sales, Product Management and Pricing capabilities to drive increased profitability. Prior to joining Wynnchurch, Alexis spent 16 years at Koch Industries where she held various leadership roles realizing key commercial bets at recently acquired companies across consumer goods, packaging and building products. Alexis holds a B.A. in Communications with a Concentration in Commerce from the University of Pennsylvania, Annenberg School for Communications & Wharton School.

Wynnchurch Capital, L.P., headquartered in the Chicago suburb of Rosemont, Illinois with an affiliate in Canada, was founded in 1999, and is a leading middle-market private equity investment firm. Wynnchurch’s strategy is to partner with middle market companies in the United States and Canada that possess the potential for substantial growth and profit improvement. Wynnchurch Capital manages a number of private equity funds with $9.2 billion of regulatory assets under management and specializes in recapitalizations, growth capital, management buyouts, corporate carve-outs and restructurings.

Dave Venker is a Vice President of Portfolio Operations at HCI Equity Partners, having joined the firm in 2019. He is involved in identifying and executing strategic and operational initiatives at portfolio companies and reviewing new investment opportunities. He brings to the position a blend of experience in middle market private equity and operating roles in industrial businesses.

In his time at HCI, Dave has worked to redefine this latest phase of the operations team’s structure and role within the firm, including the development of several programs to benefit portfolio companies, including MSI Express, WF Cabinetry, Consolidated Hospitality Supplies, SDS Rx, AmerCare Royal and Regent Cabinets. Dave works across all functions to develop and execute value creation plans, and he leads the operations team’s efforts in supply chain and operations.

Prior to joining the firm, Mr. Venker spent five years at The Jordan Company. Earlier in his career, Mr. Venker held various operational roles at GE and Eaton.

Mr. Venker has a BS degree in electrical engineering, magna cum laude, from the University of Notre Dame.

HCI Equity Partners is a lower middle market private equity firm focused on partnering with family and founder-owned manufacturing, service and distribution companies, with deep experience in end markets including aerospace and defense, automotive, building products, foodservice, industrial services, infrastructure, test and measurement and transportation and logistics. Headquartered in Washington, D.C., the firm partners with growth-oriented companies to develop and support well-defined organic and acquisition growth strategies and assist with operational improvements. For more information, visit https://www.hciequity.com/

Craig Vosburgh joined Strattam as Chief Technical Officer in 2019. In this role, he helps drive technical excellence across the Strattam portfolio.

Previously, Craig served as Distinguished Engineer in the Office of the CTO at CA Technologies where he helped create the CA Technologies’ Product Accelerator and prior to that as Senior VP Software Development while leading the turnaround of their global APM product development organization. Passionate about developing compelling, customer-facing applications, Craig previously developed software for NASA, and held senior roles at Sun Microsystems, MCI Telecommunications, Martin Marietta Information Systems, and Rockwell Space Operations.

Craig earned his B.S. in Aerospace Engineering from the University of Colorado Boulder.

Strattam Capital invests in founder-led, independent B2B software and technology companies outside of Silicon Valley. We believe in aligning with founders and CEOs before signing, via our Five-Point Plan process to allow execution with purpose, excitement, and efficiency. Headquartered in Austin, TX, we connect companies with the people, process and scale needed to reach their potential. For more information, please visit Strattam.com.

Mr. Walshe is a member of the SVP Global, North American investment team and is an operating professional. Prior to joining SVP in 2022, Mr. Walshe was the architect and leader of the portfolio operations team at Sightway Capital, a Two Sigma company. While at Sightway, he focused on due diligence, value creation and financial transformation across a portfolio of financial services and real asset companies. In addition, he was a member of the valuation and ESG committees. Prior to Sightway, Mr. Walshe was a member of Marlin Equity’s portfolio operations group and served various finance leadership functions across Marlin’s portfolio companies. Earlier in his career, Mr. Walshe was a senior consultant with PwC and A&M in their respective transaction advisory practices.

Mr. Walshe earned an MA in Accounting from the Kenan-Flagler Business School at the University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill, and a BA in Economics from Hampden-Sydney College in Virginia.
